news-item.title: Ex-Petrobras director arrested for alleged money laundering
news-item.text: Federal police in Brazil have arrested a former director of state-run oil giant Petrobras (NYSE: PBR) for alleged money laundering. Paulo Roberto Costa, Petrobras' refining chief under former CEO José Sergio Gabrielli de Azevedo, was arrested as part of the Lava Jato federal police operation, state-run news service Agência Brasil said Thursday. He was arrested in Rio de Janeiro for destroying evidence and given a provisional five-day jail term. The operation has so far led to 24 arrests in 17 cities, with suspects accused of being involved in a US$4bn laundering scheme, according to police. Police said Costa's arrest is not linked to investigations about Petrobras' controversial purchase of the Pasadena oil refinery in 2006, revealed this week. A Petrobras spokesperson could not immediately be reached for comment Thursday. http://www.bnamericas.com/story.xsql?id_sector=9&id_noticia=641487&Tx_idioma=I&source=
